title: Current version of app doesn’t work in iOS 13
text:
I am running the latest version of the iHome app on an iPhone 11 Pro Max.  This versions release notes say iOS 13 bug fixes.  Every time I launch the app it immediately crashes.  The same happens on iPadOS.  I have tried uninstalling the app many times and even that is problematic.  The app icon disappears after the uninstall but reappears after I restart my phone.  When the app does reappear on the phone it displays the white grid, icon placeholder and not the actual iHome icon.  When I go to the App Store at that point it believes the app is still installed so it gives me the option to open the app instead of install the app.

I place a lot of the blame here on Apple and iOS 13.  That’s why I’m giving a non functional app 3 stars instead of 1.  What a let down iOS 13 and iPadOS have been so far.

title: Perfect in every way, seriously.
text: I rarely write reviews but noticed this app is getting beat on for some reason, I’ve never had any issues.  This product line and app are great!  Love the products and love the app!  Setup is a breeze too!  Homekit integration works perfect and I can use Siri to turn on and off outlets.  I have 10 iSP8’s in my house and 3 iSS50 environment monitors which are great for temperature and humidity rules. The rules work perfect and I truly never have any issues at all.  Gets too hot or humid in the crawl space, no problem, the environment monitor triggers a rule and switches on an outlet that has a fan plugged into it - and notifies me via the app.  Beautiful!  Been using WiFi via UniFi access points or TimeCapsule with no issues, if you have issues make sure your signal is good and you have a good router.  My only suggestion:  Keep up the great work and roll out some cool new products I can buy! :)

title: Instructions terrible
text:
It’s hard to separate the app from the instructions and the device itself. 

I have set up 4 other brands with little effort. 

I tried to set up the device following the prompts from the app. It never asked for the passcode and setup stalled. 

I followed the alternate instructions of manually adding the device (which it did with no problem) and then adding from within the app and still no luck. I have done a hard reset after every attempt. 

Finally I manually added device to network and used HomeKit to connect to device which it did with no problem. I went back to the app and got an error message but restarted app and device was there and could be controlled from both HomeKit and the app. 
 Unfortunately, less than 5 hours after install, I needed to unplug the device and plug back in because HomeKit could no longer connect to the device. There was no problem with any other smart home device.

I then tried to add to Alexa. There is absolutely nothing in the instructions or app about how to do this. Alexa could not find the devices. 

Not sure if I will bother with not adding to Alexa (which I am trying to move away from for privacy concerns). 

Overall I am not happy with device. It really should not be this hard to add a device.  Ihomewas good enough to respond to my review, but only addressed adding to Alexa and telling me to call support. I am upping it to a 2 star based on ihome at least doing a follow up.

title: So Far No Issues
text:
First time purchase of any remotely controlled/monitored devices; a pair of ISPX6 smart plugs and an iSS50 Smart monitor. While this is an app review and not a product review they are interrelated, i.e. the performance of one influences the other. 

In this case the app and the products worked as expected. Followed the directions and I was flicking lights on and off from my iPhone like a champ in ten minutes. 

A few caveats. Apple’s Home Kit integration works fine as long as you are connected to your home network. For remote access USING HOME KIT you need a hub. But there is remote access using the iHome Control app and their cloud connection. But as earlier pointed out iHome Control only works with iHome products. 

Second-setting up rules is easy, but event triggers for the monitor to push notifications require a separate rule for each event. My first attempt was to create one rule to trigger a notification if temp went below 50°, or light or motion was detected. On test no notification. After a close reading I saw that all three conditions had to be met. Once I figured that out and set up one rule for temp, one for light and one for motion everything worked just fine.

I signed out of Alexa app, SmartThings app, iHome app, rebooted my phone, and that still didn’t work until I deleted and re-downloaded the iHome app.  That worked for a day then something happened to the iHome cloud.  Repeated steps from before after cloud was ‘fixed’ and had same issues with one but not the other.  Then the other became non-responsive as well.  Bought a different brand of smartplug now all is right in my smart home once again.  The iHome plugs are officially benched in my house.  Wasted too much time trying to resolve the issues when the had better things to do.

title: This app is fundamentally broken.  Not just a poor design.
text:
I bought an ihome leak sensor.  I followed the instructions to set it up.  The major problem is that whenever there is a popup window prompt, such as the one asking for the network password, the popup appears over and over endlessly, making setup impossible.  As such, I can use the sensor to make a local beep whenever water touches it, but impossible to set up to send remote notifications due to this software being broken.

It’s mind-boggling that this app could be released when it is fundamentally broken.  It will give you the same prompt or error endlessly until you force-close the app.  

What garbage!  I remember seeing first-time programmers make this kind of mistake in Fundamentals of Computer Science I.  Maybe they are getting high-school hobby programmers to do the work as interns or something.

I tried resetting the phone, deleting and reinstalling the iHome app from the App Store, resetting the sensor, etc.  I called iHome customer support who was unable to help.  They finally suggested that I simply wait a few hours and try again.  Why?  It didn’t work.  The app is broken.

I’m using an iPhone X on iOS 11.2.5, which at the time that I’m writing this review is the latest version available.

title: I give up.
text:
I expect that if you can get the device connected to the app, it works pretty well. 

But I can’t get by square one in setting up the app. The Quick Start instructions are very much best-case instructions. They don’t tell you that you have to download the “Home” app from the App Store, or else you’ll just be confronted with a lot of blank screens. They don’t tell you that you have to enable “Home” in iCloud, or else you’ll just see “Cloud Data Sync in Progress (77)” forever, with no indication of what that means. Even after I managed to troubleshoot these two major hurdles, I still get a blank screen when I try to connect the Smartplug device. 

Perhaps if there were better documentation, this could be workable. But by trying to make the process look simple and easy, the half-page of quick-start instructions (and nothing further) basically makes the item useless. 

And clicking on “Get Help” at the bottom of some of the screens basically leads to a more verbose version of the the quick start. No real troubleshooting, no real help. 

Not wasting my time on this any more, sending it back.

title: Very limited automation
text:
I bought the iSS50 sensor in order to automatically turn on a fan when the temperature rose above a certain point.  The fan is plugged into another brand of HomeKit-enabled plug (Koogeek).  The iHome app does not see it, so it can control it.  Isn’t providing a universal and cross-compatible platform for home automation the whole point of HomeKit?!? 

Turns out, the Koogeek app works flawlessly in setting up the automation I wanted.  It found the iHome sensor and let me use it to set up an automation routine.  So they proved it’s possible to see a and use a HomeKit device made by another company.

iHome is just pretending not to see my other device in order to make me want to buy one of their smart plugs.  No sale, iHome.  And just for that lousy behavior, I’m not planning to buy any more of your stuff.

title: Really bad design - negative star rating.
text:
I have 3 of these iHome devices setup and working with Rules. Had to change my router password and all 3 failed to reconnect after the change. iHome doesn’t even prompt for a password to reconnect. Instead, I had to setup each device from scratch and the app created duplicates of each one. In addition, I lost all my existing rules so now I have to recreate all those rules. In comparison, my Lutron didn’t bat an eyelid - it simply continued to work after the password change like nothing had happened.

Another pain point is that you don’t allow the use of special characters when naming devices or rules - not even underscore characters! That’s really inconsiderate of your users.

If you’re not creative enough to come up good user scenarios and design for them, then at least copy the good ones out there.

I guess based on your history and all the other reviews I see, I shouldn’t expect an update fixing all these issues.

Consequences are that I’ll never buy another iHome device again and will steer others away from your products.

UPDATE:
After treating two IT professionals to a very expensive dinner, they agreed to spend the evening at my house to get to the bottom of this situation. 

We erased all my Home iCloud data, signed out of my Apple ID out of each device I own, factory reset my HomePod and Apple TV’s (as these devices are your “Home Hub’s”). We then signed back into each device one-by-one before re-downloading the iHome iOS App, Factory Data Resetting each iHome Plug, and setting them up as new after verifying each device had the most up to date firmware. 

We tested each Apple product with each outlet as we went, and then assigned each smart home accessory with a Static-IP address. 

And here we are, the next evening, and everything is still working perfectly! Let’s hope it stays this way, but if something changes, I’ll update this review again. 

As of now, these products and their corresponding services are working perfectly!

——————————

First of all, I very rarely write reviews, and I don’t think I have ever left a 1-Star review before today. I will update this review when, or if, these issues are finally resolved. 

I am using an iPhone X 256GB (with over 100GB available) on iOS 11.4 (currently the newest iOS.)

I bought four iHome plugs April ‘17 when I bought my first Alexa. Everything worked flawlessly with all four plugs with Alexa, Siri, the Apple Home app, and with the proprietary iHome iOS application. 

However, about a little over a month ago issues began. At first just Siri stopped working at times. Then the Apple Home application would report outlets as randomly “Not Responding”, then Alexa stopped working, and of the last week, I can’t even get the propriety iHome iOS application to turn the lights on or off at times. 

When the issues first began to occur, I attempt to resolve the issue myself. Being an Apple Education Representative for a cellular carrier, I am familiar with the product and the steps needed to troubleshoot  these issues traditionally. 

SO, I Factory Data Reset each plug, re-setup each plug up, re-installed the iOS application from scratch, re-installed the Alexa skill from scratch, and deleted all of my Apple Home data from my iCloud. Everything was back to brand-new..... or so I thought. 

All of my hard work (about an hour and a half) allowed all of my products to work flawlessly (again) for about three hours. Then all the issues began again, until becoming unusable even within the propriety application. Two nights ago I couldn’t even turn off the lights in my bedroom or foyer to go to bed. 

So yesterday, I went and bought new Hue bulbs, and decided to go ahead and repeat all of troubleshooting to the iHome plugs AGAIN, in hopes that I would be able to use the two separate forms of smart light control all within the Apple Home app. I spent about three hours setting it all up.

Everything worked FLAWLESSLY.... for about an hour. Then the issues began again, but just with the iHome outlets. Each Hue product worked perfect, even the following day. I was so frustrated I immediately gathered all the iHome plugs and threw them into a box in my garage. 

Having spent all this money on the products, and all my time setting up the products and troubleshooting the products, it is very frustrating not to be able to USE the products. 

All I want is for the products to work. 

The fact that I am able to see online reviews of many people reporting the same issues tells me that this is not defective equipment or user error. It tells me that iHome has got something messed up awful, and is not willing to admit it and quickly fix it. 

Let’s hope one day this will all be resolved.

title: TG for Homekit
text:
Update Dec. 10, 2017
Well I’m making a drastic change in both my rating of this app and the devices but not because of improvements in the app but instead because of Homekit integration and other apps that can now work with the devices.  Yes, their app is horrid on my iPhone 6, (better on my iPad) but since deleting ALL rules in the app and instead using Homekit life with the devices is much better.  Now for Homekit details...

Integration of iHome with Homekit has let me again take control of my smart home.  Creating scenes such as morning and then automating them to run at certain times truly creates an easier carefree day, and here is just one example. 

I wake at 5:35am weekdays, I have a lighting scene automated to turn at 5:34am. I’m usually out the door by 7:50am but have setup the following rules and automation about leaving in case I leave early, etc.: Take note that due to DST and winter, sunrise and sunset really affect things by hours so rules can become complicated. When using ihome app I was always having to adjust times because the light of the day changes seasonal by several hours...

Note that “RUN” means to run the automation

Run Scene “AM Weekday ON” @ 5:34am, then...

1) Run “AM weekday OFF” scene at 7:50am 
    (accounts me leaving home at normal time)
2) Run “AM weekday OFF” scene at sunrise
    (accounts for winter darkness & summer light) 
3) Run “AM weekday OFF” when I leave 
     (Homekit geofence setup)

So the latest I ever leave is 7:50am, the other two conditions take care of conserving power if it gets light earlier or I’m ahead of schedule for leaving. 

As all of my home lighting is from solar power/batteries, conservation is always at the top.  I run other similar scenes and automations during the evenings, etc. 

I have many of iHome smart plugs using them for my lighting, Christmas tree, wax burners, plant light bulb, etc. and iHome had actually been nice enough to send me a complementary 5-in-1 SmartMonitor at no charge.  It’s sad to say that they should have done a bit more product development on it before going to market.  To even try to use the light sensor for day/night functions I had to point the light sensor outside (then anyone walking by my window could see the display data, not me lol) but found it was quite unreliable with activations, sensitivity and notifications,  I keep it in my garage now to monitor the temperature and when I’m working in there and let it control a smart plug for a salamander heater. 

So to recap, the iHome devices are now a suggested BUY THEM, but forget about controlling them with the iHome app.  Other managment functions on devices themselves such as device renaming etc. can be done quickly with the free app “Elgato Eve”

UPDATE: July 21, 2017
Ok these jerks just significantly limited their product.  They used to allow 10 rules for a device but they just changed it to 6.  If you have to change your wifi network when you do a reset the system will now only permit 6 rules.   You can't even set 1 per day now!

From their tech support when I asked about it:

"Yes, you are correct! Our developer said there were too many issue allowing 10 rules per plugs so they lower the amount of rules.  

Thanks, 
iHome Support "

After using their product over a year and them selling thousands of these devices across the country they just discover this? Yeah, right.   Smoke screen.

title: Tip for iOS 10
text:
Contacted support about not being able to setup on iOS 10. They sent me the following instructions, which worked perfectly. 

Please follow these instructions to get the plug connected-
Hold down the power button for approx. 12-15 seconds. The light will flash green, flash red and green, go out and then flash green again. Repeat this reset.
Go to the settings on your phone and tap on WiFi. You should see the iHome Smart Plug in the WiFi available networks. Tap on the plug and follow the instructions. 
Once it is connected to the WiFi you will then go into the iHome Control app and connect the plug to the Control App. 
Once you get the plug connected tap on the information i to the right and it will say edit. Then scroll to check for update. It will tell you if the plug needs an update.

In iOs device setting / iHome control / turn on all taps.
In iOs device setting / Privacy / Homekit/ iHome control / on.
In iOs device setting / iCloud / iCloud Drive / on.
In iOs device setting / iCloud / Keychain / on.

When we adjusted the settings on her iPhone to match these (the only one wrong was the iCloud Drive) everything worked like it should, and now with the HomeKit sharing feature we can both control the device using Siri!

text: This app is basically useless. It’s slow, buggy, and barely works. I use the app to turn on and off plugs when they disconnect from the Apple home app, which is very often. While I can turn on and off the devices, very slowly, when I try to identify the device or update firmware, it says the device is unreachable and I need to connect to the same wifi the device is on, but I already am. This app is just a mess in its current form.

title: I love the app but it needs improvement
text: I love the iHome app but I wish the smart plug that I own would correct to the Apple HomeKit a little bit better and let me say turn off my tv or on via Siri on the cellular date please please do that then it would be great!!!!

title: App worker well
text: It was very easy to set up and add rules. I thought I would start small with one of the plugs. I had planned to use it for outdoor Christmas lights but it is only for indoor use plus it would not fit in my covered outdoor socket. It is working well with the Christmas tree lights.

title: Works well
text:
I now have 3 smart plugs and have had no problems at all. Just followed the directions, waited for the syncing (this tool 5 minutes on one device) and it worked. 
The okay reason not five stars is rules creation and usage is confusing they need to rethink that interface.

title: Works Right Away
text:
Took like 5 mins to install two and set them up. Put in 2 rules for one of the outlets. Easy. 
As far as reliability/durability/longevity, I'll need to revisit this review. If you don't hear anything from me it must have worked out.

title: Just what we needed!
text: Easy to setup on each family member's phone. Easily set rules for automatically turning on and off in the morning and evening. Can control and monitor from hundreds of miles from home!!!!

title: Useless devices, useless app
text: I purchased a couple smart plugs just to test the devices.  So far, I have had to reset one of the devices 3 times, the other device twice and I am now on reset number 4.  Nothing is changing on my network, the devices just go offline at random.  Support says update the firmware (great if it works and I already did) and then just reset.  How about fix the devices and app communication???  Find another smart plug.

title: Horrible software. Period.
text: I have 10 SmartPlugs. I have had to reset all of them multiple times. Unresponsive and convoluted most of the time. Homekit and Siri integration is useless. It fails 85% of the time. Basically false advertising in my opinion. The app is not trustworthy - it thinks lights are on when they are actually off and vice versa. Firmware updates and hard resets don't help. The app's camera scanner can't even read it's own iHome Smart Plugs identification labels accurately. Amateur night.

title: Much improved with this update
text: They finally updated the app and it seems to be working much better. I'm still having problems with the timer feature but overall it's working okay.

title: App is busted... Maybe not completely
text:
App launches and then freezes. Can't log in which makes the device worthless. I'll take it back in the morning.

Revised - had to disable my keychain sync, reset HomeKit and then reenable Keychain but now it's working and pretty cool.  Please fix the bugs and provided better error handling.

title: Used to work
text:
Went several months with no performs after an easy setup. 

Now my house was without power for about a day and after it came back on this wouldn't connect to my smart plug.
After about 10 resets and an app reinstall on both my phone and iPad I'm getting quite frustrated. 

My network is fine it's broadcasting at 2.4 Ghz and no latency got signal etc... But after a reset this app will find the plug and start the setup process and NEVER finish... Just data fatal error after about 15-20 mins or literally gives no more info other than"seeing up device".

Using iPhone 6 with iOS 10.3.3 and latest version of the app.

title: Completely Unusable
text:
This app requires iCloud Keychain to work. If you don't want to use iCloud Keychain, the app gives constant pop-ups, making it unusable.

All I want to do is configure outlets. An app does not need to sync anything to the cloud to do this. Really the app does not need me to create a user, or even Internet access at all--just access to the local network.

Based on this app, I recommend avoiding iHome devices. Privacy is clearly not a priority.

title: Thumbs Up
text: Device works well. Little trouble setting it up, but worked on second try. Used for Christmas lights. When I brought it inside and changed to a lamp, had to forget device. Worked well and continues to work well.

title: Works great
text: Literally a 5-minute guided setup: the device auto discovered my wifi, I registered myself with the app, and registered the device with the app. Done! I connected my Wink app to iHome and everything just works. Nice job.

title: It's been getting worse with time
text: It's very difficult to separate whether or not this app is the issue, or if HomeKit is just to half-baked. That said… This app won't even login on any device despite having reinstalled. Essentially my smart plugs are bricks now. I have to use the hard button. That's the only way to get them to activate. Presently I feel like it was a huge waste of money to buy four of these dang things.

title: So far it's good
text: Working well now. With all functions working properly.  But initially the rules function did not work for a day and I just had to be patient until it started  working.  Maybe it's apple iCloud problem not sure.

title: Awesome product!
text:
I removed a time clock for my outside lighting, rewired the box for a male and female plug. Plugged in and set it up, worked perfectly. I'm using a Apple network in my home, AirPort Extreme for the router.
With this, I know control my outside lighting.
Good stuff!!

title: AMAZING
text: Awesome product. I have my Christmas tree and other lights hooked up with the plug and set it up to turn on and off at a certain time of the day. I highly recommend this product.

Great app. I like the functionality and capability that this software provides. I would recommend to anyone who has the need to control any device that you connect to the device. Just follow the instructions provided. Using SIRI to issue commands is great (fun).

title: Loved IHome Smart Plug until I got my IPhone 6s and now...
text: I have the same problems that others are reporting- app won't let me access my account- wants me to set up new and yet won't set up- very frustrating because I was so sold on these Smart Plugs- hope the app developers fix this issue quickly.

title: Works as advertised.
text: Timer feature works great. I can control my devices while across town and all over the world as long as there is internet.

title: Pleased with devices
text: A few days after installation one device/lamp did not respond. However, the next day all was well. Not sure the problem. Excellent deterrent.
